snippet: C. Ray Nagin was indicted by a federal grand jury on Friday on 21 counts including conspiracy, bribery and money laundering.
abstract: C Ray Nagin, former mayor of New Orleans who drew national notice for criticizing federal government's response to Hurricane Katrina, is indicted by federal grand jury on 21 counts including conspiracy, bribery and money laundering; charges relate to scheme of kickbacks and pay-for-play by contractors and vendors looking to work with city.
lead_paragraph: C. Ray Nagin was indicted by a federal grand jury on Friday on 21 counts including conspiracy, bribery and money laundering.

headline.seo: C. Ray Nagin, Former Mayor of New Orleans, Indicted on Corruption Charges
headline.main: Former Mayor of New Orleans Is Charged in Sweeping Corruption Case
headline.print_headline: Former Mayor of New Orleans Is Charged in Sweeping Corruption Case
